angular - responsive masonry

after gathering clevermethod's projects together, they needed a way to display their content simply, but with a little bit of "umph". after considering a few options, we decided to implement an Angular masonry grid. complete with responsive and material design, satisfying animations, and live search & filtering, clevermethod's lazy and infinitely loading project library (powered by impress) was brought to life.

vue - UI web applications

in search of something new and fun, mattel's goal was to refresh their interactive builder experience for a new and exciting line of tracks while still sticking to their brand.

vue allowed for easy animations utilizing conditional rendering. it also allowed for dynamic binding, which made the addition and removal of pieces to the shopping list effortlessly. This interactive digital experience is free for exploration, but provides the option of being guided through with a step-by-step tutorial. when a user has completed their track, they can complete their experience by printing out a list of the pieces, price, packaging, and image of their final stunt.

this experience seemed to really come together after adjusting the HUD to feel "lighter", by making any readable container slightly transparent. this allows the user to visually distinguish between each section without having the experience look or feel over-crowded. this look is maintained throughout the experience with accompanying disabled states for the stage buttons as well as for the randomize button. it is also reflected on the opposite side of the shopping list in the share tabs to provide balance to the site. this execution really tied everything together for a polished, fun experience.
